column5: YA.. Lets go shoot fish in a barrel.  Kinda takes the fun out of it .DONTCHA THINK.
Rapala DT Fat 1.  Big, fat and produce exciting strikes.

Spro frogs work best for me,and i just love using them. last year i started to use whacky style more often and worked out great for me.i had a thread here last year asking everyones opinions on colour and i think bubblegum pink was most popular choice,so i purchased a pack and they worked great. baby bass colour worked good too. i have terrible luck with spinnerbaits!  its probably me. and buzzbaits,i love using them but have never caught anything on them!! ive tried everything with them,just can get any fish to go for it lol
By far most of my Bass have been on 6" Zoom Lizard in Junebug. Even a bunch of Smallmouth by the cottage.

Big-O - chrome/black. Confidence bait, always first lure at a new spot (minus the weeds). Catches #s and usually biggest fish of the season. Great multi-species lure too (pike, walleye & big perch & crappie) 7" Berkely powerworm (texas rigged) - A close second place. Will use over a Big-O if I'm in weeds, or if the bite is slow (colours: natural, black w/ red, blue or chartruese tail) Blue fox - in-line spinner (#2,#3 - silver-blue). Will often use in a new lake to catch multispecies and see whats biting.
baby 1 fire tiger or cray fish. lazer eye spinner bait either chartreuse or white. good ol rubber worm texas rigged purple or black with red or chartreuse tail
Fixed!
Fixed!
Speak for yourself.
Always have a 5" senko (bubble gum or red shad) tied onto one of my rods at any givin time . Best for me by a long shot ! Great follow up bait for those missed fish as well.
now I remember...  a whacky rigged 5" pink stick worm.  a fish pulled the rod right out of my son's hands and into the lake with that set up.

lol, I have one of those. On Rainy river at least, it hasn't produced one fish, lol. I always wondered why though, the action looks awesome to me anyways. But If I take it off and toss a live target frog/similar frogs, bam! right away.  Now that dam spinner is for the kids cause they still think its fun to use, and if it doesn't snag, thats good for daddy too!  My favorite bass baits...  Rapala DT 10 minnow pattern Rapala Flat rap Firetiger (deadly for pike as well) Jig n' pig 6" salted Yum worms, black silver fleck, texas rigged or wacky style on a 3/8 oz. black jig Black and silver slated Yum grubs on 3/8 oz black or pink jig

What Roy said, but probably a lot more fish on a 6 inch plastic worm since the early 70`s than anything else. A lot of fish on a lot of different lures, but I almost always had a rod rigged with a worm. Favorite would be a 6 inch Zoom u tail in Junebug.  Er... for smallies? tubes.
No it's not. It's about the eating.  That's the only reason anyone would want to spend time and money dragging in those water-logged wet socks.
lol, a 10lb walleye is 60ft of water puts up a great fight, what are you guys talking about? Especially on light line

Roy is bang on as usual.  Way to many variables to give one certain lure.  Picture it like this.. you have to be sure to get whatever bait they want in the fishes face.  And for the right amount of time.  If you go to a country line dancing bar to meet a fine lady wearing your popped Polo lime green golf shirt and skin tight khaki pants with sperry topsiders and doing your best MC hammer on the dance floor... well, you may not get bit.  However, switch to other certain locales with the same getup, you'd probably have a good chance.  If I had to pick one.. ole' Pig and Jig.

There are lots of great Bass lures.  Many have been listed here already.  My personal favourite in the early season is a plastic toad/frog.  However I will bet that more bass are caught on plastic worms than all other baits combined!  If I have to produce fish, day-in-day-out a 5" plastic worm is what I want.  You can fish it weightless, Texas rig it, drag it on a jig shaky style, cast or bounce or drag and swim it weighted Carolina style, nose hook it and fish it over the weeds and slop, hook it wacky under a bobber, put it on a worm harness and cast or troll it...etc. etc. etc.
Most effective bait? Re-read what Roy said.  Most fun is another matter. For me, that's anything on the surface. For smallmouth, that would be a Heddon Tiny Torpedo. For buckets, probably a buzzbait.
My favourite bait to use is a 1/2oz Netbait Paca jig with a Yum Chunk trailer.  I had more fun using this bait last year than any other bait I own.
Flame Red and Gold Original Hot N Tot.
spinnerbaits, for largemouth and smallies.  my favourite has to be the red and white strikekings.
12" Muskie baits.. they're just that stupid!  Oh.. and to show I'm not just snuffin the species...
XR 10 in Perch for me, but also A Berkley Frenzy Walker in the frog pattern. I haven't the patience to fish Senkos, I like to be working a bait.

5am. calm waters dying flutter from heddon lures. nothing beats the swirl and the big jump.   This brings me back to the end of August 2009 when I caught my biggest largemouth on a popper, aside from tv this is the best way to of captured it....word for word pictures and video...check it out 1:58min long..it's good  http://s284.photobucket.com/albums/ll5/MCTFisher/?action=view&current=PBBass.mp4

Crazy crawler Hoola popper 6" rapella floating pertch with a small split shot 24" up skitter pop And of course live bait always works best  WATERDAWG If any one has any they dont use or want let me know   (discontinude about 15yrs ago) I will pay 10 bucks a piece   The classics...

Mepps Aglia Long #3 is a fall to for when nothing else is working and there are plenty others that I love, tube jigs, yum dingers, Chug bug for top water. There are to many all have there times that are very productive and another isn't also depends on Smallie or Large but there are to many for me to name off lol. Also Square bill crankbaits are great.
and lots of it
From opening day to ice up, Jig and Pig hands down.  Never leave the dock without one!

There is so much that is effective according to conditions. As Mr. Ritchie says i too am stuck on topwaters most of the season. The Heddon Spittin Image specifically is my favourite topwater by far. The frog Jitterbug and small Zara Spooks have also been good.
Live northern leopard frogs on a custom home made weedless quick strike rig

I love top water baits for SMB...that surface smash always gets my heart racing like nothing else.  My "go to" is a Zara spook or a similar walking style bait by Excalibur that I believe is called a "Sammy"...most walkers are good so I'm eager to try out the Live Target frogs I just got.  Bring on the last week end in June!!!!!

What's your number one bass bait?  My LiveTarget Yellow Perch lure has been the best I have lure I have ever owned. It seems to work even on bad days. Not only does it catch Bass, but Ive caught Pike, Catfish, and even Walleye. These lures are great!
Recently bought a couple live target lures. But my go to is a white tube jig or a pink senko. I also love the rapala j-9's i have one in a discontinued colour that works for me everytime!
for the last 3 seasons it's been a Zarra Super Spook in Baby Bass pattern.  nothing beats that topwater strike
Scum frog with the little paddle legs.  Almost like a slow motion buzz bait.  I love watching the bass crush it.
I forget what Bass look like as I want Walleye and Musky.  I found bass and a shakey head jig with a 'senko' type bait is best for those pesty buggers.
WATERDAWG on riany days with a strong low preasure system /cold soft rian and next to no wind.(MID TO LATE SUMMER)  KILLER  Bass /pike/pics/muskey its a slice of heaven
white 4" tube with black or silver fleck on a 4/O wide gap hook although a watermelon/pearl senko (or clone) laminate won't let you down
worse, it's less then 3LB
Fishing Walleye is not about the fight, it is about the chase.
I'm old shool.... Jitterbug leopard green pattern
YEP!!! Throw out a 5" on a calm night when they are active LOOKOUT.  My father always said BIG BAIT =BIG FISH.... It takes patiance but well worth it.
Ah yes.  "I think I have a good one here".  "Ahhhh.   Sheephead!!   Crap".
Strikezone slammer Big O Subwat 7cm tube senko x-rap
No one for spinnerbaits?
Spinnerbaits, Spro Frog, Slammer, Bassmagnet Tube Tight Lines SBK

Same... Can't stand bass fishing...  And the smallie tournament record was set a couple miles from my dock...  Walleye taste great and musky are just plain mean...  Geoff... You just gotta try trophy carp fishing now... Keeps you entertained in the spring...

Ugh, I can't narrow it down but in my eyes in the 7 weeks I fished bass every day last year the bass either would eat a Snag Proof frog over the duckweed or the didn't after 45mins of hitting a few spots...So I picked up a Booyah Pigskin jig and it always made fish come to the boat.  Best Bait, just love the appearance of my Hack Attack Jigs by Strike King...going to be a good dozen big bass this summer you guys will see with that stuck in the hood of it's mouth!
5am. calm waters dying flutter from heddon lures. nothing beats the swirl and the big jump.
well its a tough one?? hmmmm i will go with a wacky rigged senko!!!! its awesome second choice would be a river 2 sea frog!!!

You can't really name any specific bait without knowing the type of bass, time of the year, weather conditions, water temp., water clarity, calm or choppy. For example, a surface bait might be your best bait but I doubt very much that it would be your go to if you were on a windswept lake over 40 FOW. As long as the bait's action is good, almost any surface bait will produce over calm, shallower, weedy water. Tubes and critters in weed pockets. Cranks and tubes over rocks. etc... Well at least that's my opinion.
Day in and day out for largies has to be a jig and pig.
AHHH HAHAHAHAHAHA  hum, that's a thought I never had before...
Plastic crawfish, texas rigged w/ Tungsten worm weight worked slowly where there's rocks and weeds together or in slop.  Otherwise, lucky craft redemption spinnerbait in shad pattern.
big ol nightcrawler hooked one time through the head, fished weightless

Does anyone use those topwater frog buzzbaits? I think there from Rebel, with the back legs working like propeller kicking up water. Its not my favourite bass lure but man is it fun, and a producer for anything. If ya dont have one go to crappie tire and grab one . Its a blast!
